resources.string: Some permissions were denied. The app may not work properly.
GNSS Background Service enabled - will auto-start on boot
GNSS Background Service disabled - will not auto-start
• Available network interfaces for client connections (enable Wi-Fi hotspot to see its IP-address):\n%s• Server port: 8887 (TCP)

1. Enable Required Permissions:
 • Grant all requested permissions above
 • Enable 'Allow all the time' for location access
 • Allow GNSS Server app to run on background
 • Disable battery optimizations for the app in order to prevent delays of GNSS coordinates delivering and frequent disconnections

2. Enable WiFi Hotspot

3. Start GNSS Server:
 • Tap 'Enable Service'
 • The server will run in the background and show a persistent notification

4. Connect Client Device:
 • Install the GNSS Client app to your car system
 • Select GNSS Client app as provider of mock locations using developer settings
 • Launch the GNSS Client app and grant all requested permissions, if needed
 • On your car system, connect to the WiFi hotspot
 • Start the GNSS Client app service and ensure it connects to the server
 • The GNSS Client app service will run in the background and show a persistent notification (if notifications are supported by a car system)
